clinical_study.brief_title: A Survey on Low Blod Sugar Among Insulin-treated Patients With Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: An International Survey on Hypoglycaemia Among Insulin-treated Patients With Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted globally. The aim of this study is to describe the proportion of patients with hypoglycaemic episodes and estimate the incidence of various types of hypoglycaemia in the retrospective and prospective periods.

primary_outcome.measure: The percentage of patients who experience at least 1 hypoglycaemic episode

secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the 4 weeks before and 4 weeks after the baseline (day 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of hypoglycaemic episodes requiring hospital admission
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the 6 months before and 4 weeks after the baseline (day 1)
In the 6 months before and 4 weeks after the baseline (day 1)
In the 4 weeks before and 4 weeks after the baseline (day 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of documented symptomatic hypoglycaemic episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the 4 weeks after the baseline visit (day 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of all hypoglycaemic episodes associated with a blood glucose measurement below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dl) irrespective of symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: In the 4 weeks following the baseline visit (day 1)
Between midnight and 6 a.m. in the 4 weeks before and 4 weeks after the baseline visit (day 1)
In the 4 weeks following the baseline visit (day 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients consulting a doctor
Proportion of patients increasing calorie intake
Proportion of patients avoiding physical exercise
Proportion of patients reducing or skipping insulin dose
Proportion of patients increasing the number of blood glucose monitoring as a result of fear of hypoglycaemia or hypoglycaemic episodes
Proportion of patients taking any sick leave, sick days or short days as a result of hypoglycaemic episodes

intervention.description: This study comprises of a two-part SAQ (Self-Assessment Questionnaire). Paired responses to SAQ1 and SAQ2 will be used to estimate the differences in the frequency of hypoglycaemic episodes between the retrospective and prospective periods.

study_pop.textblock: Male or female patients with T1DM (Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus) or T2DM (Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus) treated with insulin for more than 12 months who are 18 years or older, ambulatory, literate, and have signed the Informed Consent form may participate in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Informed consent obtained before any trial-related activities
- Patient with T1DM or T2DM treated with insulin for more than 12 months
- Male or female patient at least 18 years of age at the time of inclusion in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous participation in this study
- Mental incapacity, unwillingness or language barriers precluding adequate understanding or cooperation
- Illiterate patients and patients otherwise unable to sign the Informed Consent or complete a written survey
- Non-ambulatory patients
- Simultaneous participation in any other clinical study with an investigational product
